page.title: 05RECREATION part 2 cont.
page.content: The Centre is currently heavily subsidised by the G.L.C and in future will be financed by the Sports Council itself. In an attempt to attract more potential customers, concessions for families and the unemployment have been made avaliable. The disabled have also been integrated into the scheme of things, which hasn't been easy due to the lack ot structural provision for them when the Centre was constructed in 1963. This has been rectified with the introduction of ramps and so on. Generally, the community is becoming more involved, realizing you don't have to be a Superman (or Superwoman) to enjoy the challenges. A sobering thought to end on though, Archery is available only occasionally on a 'come and try it' basis and the participants standard isn't high.
